docs.lead_paragraph: Why the Supreme Court decision on Harris v. Quinn was a bigger loss for labor than people think.

headline.seo: The Supreme Court Ruling on Harris v. Quinn Is a Blow for Unions

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Cynthia Estlund and Prof William E Forbath criticizes Supreme Court decision that unions cannot collect fees from public employees who do not want to join; contends ruling is bigger loss for labor than people think; asserts unions are reeling as court sided with those who seek to further weaken workers' ability to join with co-workers and bargain collectively.
docs.snippet: Why the Supreme Court decision on Harris v. Quinn was a bigger loss for labor than people think.

byline.original: By CYNTHIA ESTLUND and WILLIAM E. FORBATH

docs.lead_paragraph: Patients in a randomized trial who had a steroid/anesthetic injection for the condition had no less pain than patients given anesthetic alone.

headline.main: Common Back and Leg Pain Treatment May Not Help Much, Study Says
headline.print_headline: Common Back and Leg Pain Treatment May Not Help Much, Study Says

docs.abstract: Study published in The New England Journal of Medicine finds steroid injections for spinal stenosis, widely used method of treating common cause of back and leg pain, may provide little benefit for many patients; steroid injections are often tried when physical therapy or anti-inflammatory medication fails, with the aim of avoiding expensive surgery; some insurance companies require injections before approving surgery.
docs.snippet: Patients in a randomized trial who had a steroid/anesthetic injection for the condition had no less pain than patients given anesthetic alone.

keywords.value: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Though they are strong supporters of the Democratic Party, they tend not to turn out in nonpresidential election years like this one.

headline.main: To Hold Senate, Democrats Rely on Single Women
headline.print_headline: To Hold Senate, Democrats Rely on Single Women

docs.abstract: Democrats and allied groups are stepping up an aggressive push to woo single women to cast their ballots in midterm elections; decline of marriage over the last generation has helped create emerging voting bloc, but challenge for Democrats is that, though they are strong supporters of Democratic Party, single women tend not to turn out in nonpresidential election years.
docs.snippet: Though they are strong supporters of the Democratic Party, they tend not to turn out in nonpresidential election years like this one.

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers say transactions worth $3.75 billion were compromised, though it is not clear how much was stolen.
docs.abstract: Security researchers have uncovered what they believe is significant cybercrime operation in Brazil that took aim at $3.75 billion in transactions by Brazilians; it is unclear what percentage of compromised transactions was actually stolen.
docs.snippet: Researchers say transactions worth $3.75 billion were compromised, though it is not clear how much was stolen.

byline.contributor: Dan Horch contributed reporting from São Paulo, Brazil.

docs.lead_paragraph: Californians paid a quarter of a billion dollars in health insurance premiums during a 15-month period ended last year that were deemed excessive by state regulators, a consumer group said Wednesday.

headline.main: Californians Spent $250 Million on Excessive Health Premiums, Group Says
headline.print_headline: Californians Spent $250 Million on Excessive Health Premiums, Group Says

headline.main: Hobby Lobby, or When Corporations Get Things Both Ways

docs.abstract: Monday’s contraception case decision made a muddle of the longstanding concept of “corporate separateness.”

docs.lead_paragraph: Business owners who don't want to pay for their employees' birth control are ending that coverage after the Supreme Court said they could choose on grounds of religious belief not to comply with part of the health care law.

headline.print_headline: Ruling Won't Alter Birth-Control Coverage for Many

docs.lead_paragraph: Stephen Gaskin, a counterculture visionary who led a caravan of hippies from California to establish one of the country's longest lasting communes in rural Middle Tennessee and later sought the Green Party nomination for president, has died. He was 79.

headline.main: Stephen Gaskin Dies; Founded 'The Farm' Commune
